about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: In a vehicle equipped with airbags, the safest place for children age 12 and under to ride is in:

about.name: In a vehicle equipped with airbags, the safest place for children age 12 and under to ride is in:

hasPart.assesses: In a vehicle equipped with airbags, the safest place for children age 12 and under to ride is in: | In a vehicle equipped with airbags, the safest place for children age 12 and under to ride is in: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: While airbags provide supplemental protection for adults in the event of a crash, they pose a severe safety risk for children. Anyone age 12 or under should sit in the back seat of a vehicle with airbags.

comment.text: The front seat.
The back seat.

suggestedAnswer.text: The bed of a pick-up truck.

comment.text: The bed of a pick-up truck.
The back seat.

answerExplanation.text: While airbags provide supplemental protection for adults in the event of a crash, they pose a severe safety risk for children. Anyone age 12 or under should sit in the back seat of a vehicle with airbags.

comment.text: In a vehicle equipped with airbags, the safest place for children age 12 and under to ride is in: | While airbags provide supplemental protection for adults in the event of a crash, they pose a severe safety risk for children. Anyone age 12 or under should sit in the back seat of a vehicle with airbags.

hasPart.name: What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights?

about.name: What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights?

hasPart.assesses: What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights? | What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You may sometimes turn right when stopped by a solid red light. You may never turn left or right when stopped by a traffic light with a red arrow.

suggestedAnswer.text: Red arrows are only used to stop traffic which is turning.

comment.text: Red arrows are only used to stop traffic which is turning.

suggestedAnswer.text: Red arrows are only used for protected turn lanes.

comment.text: Red arrows are only used for protected turn lanes.

suggestedAnswer.text: You cannot turn on a red arrow, even if you stop first.

comment.text: You cannot turn on a red arrow, even if you stop first.

acceptedAnswer.text: You cannot turn on a red arrow, even if you stop first.

comment.text: You cannot turn on a red arrow, even if you stop first.

answerExplanation.text: You may sometimes turn right when stopped by a solid red light. You may never turn left or right when stopped by a traffic light with a red arrow.

comment.text: What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights? | You may sometimes turn right when stopped by a solid red light. You may never turn left or right when stopped by a traffic light with a red arrow.

hasPart.name: After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your driving lane when:

about.name: After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your driving lane when:

hasPart.assesses: After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your driving lane when: | After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your driving lane when: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Before you return to your driving lane, be sure you are not dangerously close to the vehicle you have just passed. One way to do this is to look for the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror. When you can see both headlights in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to your driving lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: The driver you passed signals for you to return to your lane.

comment.text: The driver you passed signals for you to return to your lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: You signal your intention for three seconds.

comment.text: You signal your intention for three seconds.

suggestedAnswer.text: You see the headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.

comment.text: You see the headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.

acceptedAnswer.text: You see the headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.

comment.text: You see the headlights of the passed vehicle in your rearview mirror.

answerExplanation.text: Before you return to your driving lane, be sure you are not dangerously close to the vehicle you have just passed. One way to do this is to look for the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror. When you can see both headlights in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to your driving lane.

comment.text: After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your driving lane when: | Before you return to your driving lane, be sure you are not dangerously close to the vehicle you have just passed. One way to do this is to look for the vehicle in your inside rearview mirror. When you can see both headlights in your rearview mirror, you may have enough room to return to your driving lane.

hasPart.name: Roadways are the most slippery:
hasPart.assesses: Roadways are the most slippery: | Roadways are the most slippery: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Many roads are most slippery during the first rain after a dry spell because oil and dust on the road have not previously been washed away.

comment.text: During a heavy downpour.

suggestedAnswer.text: After it has been raining for awhile.

comment.text: After it has been raining for awhile.

suggestedAnswer.text: During the first rain after a dry spell.

comment.text: During the first rain after a dry spell.

acceptedAnswer.text: During the first rain after a dry spell.

comment.text: During the first rain after a dry spell.

answerExplanation.text: Many roads are most slippery during the first rain after a dry spell because oil and dust on the road have not previously been washed away.

comment.text: Roadways are the most slippery: | Many roads are most slippery during the first rain after a dry spell because oil and dust on the road have not previously been washed away.
